reviews.review:
La modalità prevista in questo titolo, riprende molto da vicino il tipico gioco del nascondino, ma lo eleva a qualcosa di più ansiogeno e subdolo per via dei "compiti" da portare a termine al fine d fuggire dal livello e così vincere la partita. Questo ovvìamente se si impersona un "fuggitivo", cosa diversa invece, per quanto riguarda la figura del killer che darà ovviamente del filo da torcere ai sopravvissuti al fine di evitare la loro fuga dal livello.
Il tutto fila liscio molto bene e le partite sono molto divertenti, se non per alcuni nei che a volte minano l'esperienza di gioco:
1- killer (qualcuno ha parlato di Michael Myers?) troppo OP se raggiunto il 3* livello di "furia"
2- bug relativi la compenetrazione del personaggio con l'ambiente e soprattutto coi pallet adibiti alla fuga, che spesso portano il sopravvissuto a trovarsi dalla parte sbagliata mentre tenta il driblaggio ai danni del Killer
3- bug del killer usato dalla Cpu, che spesso lo si ritrova in Afk  per tutto il match, minando tanto la suspense e l'atmosfera del gioco
4- infine, il problemino della fuga dal killer in cui, anche superato un ostacolo, questo colpisce e affonda il colpo sul sopravvissuto.
Per il resto il gioco è da provare, magari non ancora a prezzo pieno. Ricorda un pò il gioco Dead Realm per alcune meccaniche.

Short Opinion:
It's fun with friends, its fun to kill. Its got a community akin to league. It's got the biggest player base of all current asymmetrical horror games.

Also bugs tend to come and go, and any veteran can give you a history of the funny ones.


Long opinion:

Returning to the game after about a year hiatus, I have a couple of things to say on my return (for those who care i play solo-que survivor and killer about 30/50% each respectively, with the remaining 20% being swf)

Firstly, as it stands, this is your only option for a decent horror multiplayer asymmetrical game. Other's like Friday the 13th, tend to flop, or others are small party games for friends. Last year might prove some decent competition, but reflecting on its discord release, its not likely. (Also important to mention, Identity V is also a nice similar game with a mobile and pc version)

The game's come a long way in balance. From what used to be a HEAVILY survivor sided game now is quite a bit more balanced, but saying killer's are op is too broad of a statement. It's better to look at killers on an individual basement. It does go to mention however, that most new killer perks are not clearly thought about if used on other killers, which has on many occasions caused broken load-outs. Most infinites are gone, there's 1/4 as many pallets on the map then before, and most broken survivor perks are either gone, or have a decent anti-perk that's worth running on killer.

I do think some options on killer, specifically anything on nurse, can be borderline unfair to play against. I'm aware of the argument of you just have to learn to out play her but from a killer who was invented to prevent infinites, she's dated and frankly, a good nurse will almost always win.

In addition, survivors have around 5-10 good perks, another 10 decent ones, then the rest are either super situational, or just bad past your first 30 hours in the game. It feels frustrating how trying to mix-up your play-style on survivor just leads to a more difficult and frustrating time, as more gimicky play-styles get pushed out. Stealth perks require several to be equipped to be able to combat some detection but with situational requirements or limited use, and then leave you weak in other regards, as well as requires you to buy 5 dlc's, or wait weeks for the shrine to give you what you need. Killers like nurse, who's weakness was stealth, can be fixed by slapping on bbq, or some other gen monitoring perk. Also, no survivor is unique, and once you reach a certain point they are just glorified skins, with most females being shorter models, being the better option.

Killer feels great, as in killers who have counter-play feel great once you play for longer amounts of time. Something about playing killers that basically boil down to spending about 5-20 (or more depending on your pacing) hours learning how to use their ability, such as spirit and nurse, to then only be able to be able to be countered if you're using your base kit, gets boring fairly quick. When there's little struggle, the rewards starts to feel unearned. Other killers, such as trapper, hag, pig, and huntress, will always have a weakness no matter what you put on them.

Bloodlust, still exists. When it was implemented it was understandable, there were a massive amount of loops that the survivor could just keep away from the killer for all time, and run them around the entire match. But now with all the map tweaks, there's 1-2 locations where bloodlust might be necessary. All it does now, is remove the ability for a survivor to outplay a killer. It's very simple to just wait around a medium sized loop, avoiding breaking a pallet, to just gain speed until the survivor has little to no options on what to do against you. There's already plenty of unsafe pallets as is, and you can't counter bloodlust without walls or not running away. While it does take time to build bloodlust, its marginally shorter of a time waster then then the survivor making it to a another place to run you around since they pulled off a juke.

The game sucks for solo que survivor. Much alike how swf groups are a pain for killers, the same goes for solo survivors. Balance tends to be more focused on dealing with a 4-man group. So things like noed, or blindness, are fairly weak against a 4 man. When you're solo with no communication, a perk like noed can alone end a match you were winning. Its not a simple fix to separate ques for a killer to opt in and out of going against swf, but if they made the option to, solo survivors should have the ability to win exclusive cosmetics, and killers who opt into swf the same. It would keep ques alive for swf, while not hindering killers who want to rank up, and survivors who wish to play solo. These opt-in modes would have a separate ranking, but upon certain thresholds, yield cosmetic rewards that would be all the worthwhile.

The game varies from states of being a buggy mess, to being semi-decent at normally operating. You will have games where a bug fucks you over. Other games it'll be funny. However, game-play bugs should take priority in fixing. I don't know how to code so I can't say it's easy, but there should be more quality assurance before full releases are made, and they can very well afford it.

As it stands tho, if you're survivor and want to have a good time, play with friends. If you're killer, I ask you, if you were on the receiving end of what you were doing, would you enjoy yourself? Though that statement is subject to bias, as I play trapper and despise nurse.
This game is hands down, one of my favorite games that stays fresh with the updates. With so much to achieve, even with hundreds of hours.

I won't bother telling you DBD is a competitive game. Killers and Survivors should start with tier 1 of every perk; (totally against the current monetization scheme) but it will take hundreds of hours and every dlc to experience an even playing field. DBD is a survival horror game, and I've been trying to survive the horror of it trying to be competitive for thousands of hours, hoping it improves. The best thing I can say, DBD is a great exercise in patience.

Se trata de un survival horror multijugador en el que tendrás que sobrevivir a las malas intenciones de un asesino al que se enfrentaran un total de 4 supervivientes. La única arma que podrás utilizar para sobrevivir es tu habilidad, audacia y tus compañeros de equipo, a la vez que activais un total de 5 motores para poder abrir las puertas de salida, la única manera que tendreis los 4.

Es un juego tremendamente adictivo, variedad de supervivientes, asesinos y habilidades para todos ellos, hay habilidades exclusivas para cada uno de ellos y otras muchas comunes que podrás desbloquear para obtener ventajas.

Lo recomiendo 100%, el juego te reta a mejorar tu habilidad y audacia para enfrentarte a asesinos y supervivientes.

I wanted so badly to like this game. As a fan of horror, I was so excited to try my luck running from psycho killers with my friends (and throwing them to the wolves). 

The concept is great, but the execution is shallow. Ignoring bugs, the difficulty finding games, and rampant bots, I just can't get into it. The leveling system feels like it came out of a mobile game (minus the microtransactions) and the ranking system is just awful. You can start generators, stay close to the killer, save your buddies, and escape and barely gain any rank, then fuck up one game and lose it all. I know my playtime is low, but that's all the will I could muster to play. Maybe I'll try it again in the future, but for now, I'm just disappointed.

It feels like a <$10 game

In General, I'd give this game a 8/10.. It's fun to play from time to time, especially with friends. The Graphics are okay and the sounds quite good.

BUT at the moment this game just sucks. It has so many bugs it is almost ridiculous. In fact it is so buggy that it's hard to even get into a game lobby at the moment. 
I never had to quit any game that often through the task manager. Ever! Within the last two days I wasnt able to join a SINGLE GOD DAMN MATCH!! What the hell?! Every time it just stops at the loading screen until different menus overlap and nothing happens after that. 
The Matchmaking also sucks - total noobs without any perks get into lobbys with lvl 1 killers (which is the highest level you can achieve). What the hell?! You also can't play as a killer in an online match and invite for example a friend of you to join.
Also recently the Micheal Myers DLC destroyed the balance of the game. There's no heartbeat to warn you until he is literally smelling your trousers full of poop cause he's so near. And often once you're hit you're dircetly going down. No second chance. This just sucks. And to top if off most killers are fucking campers just watching you die with no chance for your team to save you. "Patrolling" some call it.. sure...

Overall I can not fully recommend buying this altough I'd like to.

Super Game! Macht mega Spaß, sowohl alleine als auch mit Freunden! Wenn man mit Freunden spielt: Große "Hassgefahr" :D Wenn man einmal damit anfängt, dann kann man nicht mehr aufhören. Gameplay ist super, genauso wie Grafik und der Spielespaß. Das einzige was nervt sind die Serverprobleme die gerne mal auftreten wenn man als Survivor spielt => Man kann teilweise zwischen 10-20 Minuten darauf warten in eine Lobby zu kommen.
Ansonten ist das Game einfach nur super und die Killer- und Survivor Ideen sind einfach spitze! :)
Very funny, competative game!

Firstly, I put off buying this game because none of my friends played it or had any interest in it so that took away part of what brings people to this kind of game. Another reason was that it just simply looked uninteresting if am I honest. 

But I was wrong. 

I waited and waited for the Friday the 13th game to be released by Halloween and when it got pushed back I gave this game another look and decided to buy it as a means to fill the craving for Friday the 13th. 

And I love it! Friends or not, this game is actually tense, suspenceful, gripping and plain ol' fun! (plus the option to be Halloween's Michael Myers and Lorrie is pretty damn awesome and so worth it). If you love horror movies/ games you gotta buy this! VERY RECOMMENDED

Вот и пролетели 310 часов моей игры в этот, еще на мой взгляд, сырой симулятор свинки. Я купил эту игру в июне этого года, когда крюки давали по тысяче очков и не оповещали маньяка, когда не были заколочены окна на втором этаже здания карты МакМиллана, когда на комбайне можно было бесконечно троллить маньяка (чем я редко занимался) и "Найти выход" еще был переведен как "Найти выйти". Нерфы конечно полностью оправданные, но немножко просыпается ностальгия. Впрочем, достаточно воспоминаний, приступим к описанию аспектов самой игры: Вы спавнитесь с остальными тремя вашими тиммейтами, или по совместимости друзьями, и идете [strike]сразу лутаться в подвал[/strike] чинить генераторы. Всего в игре их надо починить пять, дабы открыть ворота и сбежать. Так же сбежать может через трапдор один последний выживший (или все, если был взят с собой ключ). Может и даже случиться так, что во время починки генера вас увидит маньяк, положит и понесет на крюк. Что же делать? У маньяка хватка и вы не успеваете сбежать. Но вы верите всей душой, что ваши товарищи придут на помощь. На момент написания обзора альтруистов в игре малова - то. Всему же причина - кемперство. Кемперство - это когда маньяк стоит рядом с вами и ни на что не отвлекаясь [strike]рассматривает прыщи на вашем лице[/strike] вас охраняет, пока вы не умрете. Даже сейчас случаются ситуации, когда маньяк уходит на другой конец карты, а ваши тиммейты боятся даже близко к вам подойти. И это происходит не только на низких рангах, но и на высших. Естественно такое происходит не всегда. Бывает и так, что вся ваша тима сразу после вашего повешения бежит вам на помощь, еще и в подвал. Кстати о маньяках, в игре их на данный момент пять: Траппер, ХиллБилль, Колокольчик, Медсестра и Майкл Майерс в длц. На данный момент бомбежку вызывает именно последний. В день выхода медсестры кто - то может сказать, так же говорили мол, имба, но нашли же как контрить. Да, Медсестру нашли как контрить, нужно отбегать\прятаться во время ее блинка, ибо после него она оглушена. У Майкла Майерса подобной же слабости - банально нет. Это еще более стелсовый колокольчик, только со встроеным НОЕДом. Его определенно позже серьезно пофиксят, как пофиксили медсестру, но все же. Ну, вот пожалуй и все что я хотел сказать. В целом игра [b]не плоха, даже для своего жанра оригинальна, но определенно нуждается в доработке. 7 бесконечных НОЕДов при выходе игры из 10.
